title: Translucent white sticky headers, hero headline wrapping, and restored II login triggers

requirements.summary: Unify Landing + dashboard headers to a sticky translucent white style with subtle divider and backdrop blur (no heavy shadows).
acceptanceCriteria: LandingPage and each dashboard page header is sticky and uses a translucent white background (not solid dark/gray).
A backdrop blur is applied (e.g., via Tailwind backdrop-blur classes) so content behind the header appears blurred when scrolling.
There is a subtle bottom border/divider line; there is no heavy shadow on the header.
Header content (logo/text/buttons) remains readable on scroll across light backgrounds.

file_operations.description: Add a shared header utility/class (e.g., an @layer components class) that applies: sticky top positioning, translucent white background, backdrop blur, and a subtle bottom divider while avoiding heavy drop shadows. This enables consistent header styling across Landing and all dashboards.

Update the Landing page <header> to use the shared translucent-white + backdrop-blur + subtle divider header styling (replacing the current fully transparent header) while keeping existing layout/navigation intact.
Update the Admin dashboard <header> styling to match the shared translucent white header (ensure subtle divider and blur remain; remove/avoid heavy header shadows).
Update the Client dashboard <header> styling to match the shared translucent white header (sticky, blur, subtle divider; no heavy shadow).
Update the Asistenmu dashboard <header> styling to match the shared translucent white header (sticky, blur, subtle divider; no heavy shadow).
Update the Partner dashboard <header> styling to match the shared translucent white header (sticky, blur, subtle divider; no heavy shadow).

requirements.summary: Adjust Landing hero headline copy/casing and typography so it renders as exactly two explicit lines with a smaller font size.
acceptanceCriteria:
The hero headline text is exactly:
Line 1: "Tenang menjalani hari,"
Line 2: "Didampingi oleh Asistenmu dengan rapi."
The hero headline font size is reduced from the current sizing so each sentence fits on a single line on typical mobile and desktop widths (no unintended wrapping beyond the explicit line break).
Only the hero headline typography/copy is changed; other hero content remains intact.

file_operations.description: Update the hero headline to the requested two-line copy with the corrected casing on line 2, and reduce headline typography sizing so each sentence stays on its own line (beyond the explicit line break) on typical mobile/desktop widths while leaving other hero content unchanged.

requirements.summary: Ensure every "Masuk"/login control reliably triggers the existing Internet Identity login flow with proper loading/disabled state, without changing immutable auth-hook files.
acceptanceCriteria: Every UI control labeled "Masuk" (or otherwise intended to log in) triggers the II login flow and successfully authenticates the user.
After a successful login from public pages, the app can proceed to the existing role-based routing behavior (e.g., redirect to /dashboard and onward as currently implemented).
No changes are made to files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (authentication hooks are composed/used as-is).
Login buttons properly handle the logging-in state (disabled/loading) to prevent double-click issues.

file_operations.description: Create a shared "Masuk" login button component that composes the existing Internet Identity hook logic (useInternetIdentity) to call login(), uses loginStatus to disable/indicate loading to prevent double-clicks, and (when applicable) clears query cache on logout. Use the selected "authorization" component’s frontend authentication guidance for handling login status and cache clearing; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Replace the Landing page inline handleLogin + "Masuk" button wiring with the shared MasukButton component so clicking "Masuk" consistently triggers the II login flow and reflects the logging-in disabled/loading state. Use the selected "authorization" component’s frontend authentication guidance; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align AuthButton’s login click handling with the shared II login flow expectations (e.g., ensure disabled state during loginStatus === 'logging-in' and consistent error handling), without editing immutable hook files. Use the selected "authorization" component’s frontend authentication guidance; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
